metadata.title: Anti-tumor effects of Abnormal Savda Munziq on the transplanted cervical cancer (U27) mouse model

abstract.original_text: Background: Abnormal Savda Munziq (ASMq), a traditional uyghur medicine, has shown anti-tumour properties in vitro. it was showed that total flavonoids of ASMq could inhibit the proliferation and enhance the antioxidant ability of human cervix cancer HeLa cell. This study attempts to confirm these effects on the transplanted cervical cancer (U27) mouse model in vivo.

it was showed that total flavonoids of ASMq could inhibit the proliferation and enhance the antioxidant ability of human cervix cancer HeLa cell .
This study attempts to confirm these effects on the transplanted cervical cancer ( U27 ) mouse model in vivo .
